item.title: [Allstar]Its returning null, why?
item.dc:creator: @arham_4 arham 4
item.description:
@arham_4 wrote:

[quote=“Vain_, post:33, topic:520657”][quote author=Ambokile link=topic=639155.msg4308655#msg4308655 date=1370364065]

What does client extend? Player?

ye sir. I mentioned that in my post.

No you didn’t, I just had a look. Go to the Player constructor and do some debug prints, too.
[/quote]do it with something other than letters; and also post the player constructor[/quote]
I just did this:

	public Player(final int _playerId) {
		System.out.println("a");
		playerId = _playerId;
		System.out.println("b");
		// playerName = "player"+playerId;
		playerRights = 0; // player rights
		System.out.println("c");
		for (int i = 0; i < playerItems.length; i++)
			playerItems[i] = 0;
		for (int i = 0; i < playerItemsN.length; i++)
			playerItemsN[i] = 0;
		System.out.println("d");
		for (int i = 0; i < playerLevel.length; i++)
			if (i == 3) {
				playerLevel[i] = 98;
				System.out.println("e");
				playerXP[i] = 1155;
				System.out.println("f");
			} else {
				playerLevel[i] = 1;
				System.out.println("g");
				playerXP[i] = 0;
				System.out.println("h");
			}
		System.out.println("i");
		for (int i = 0; i < playerBankSize; i++)
			bankItems[i] = 0;
		System.out.println("j");
		for (int i = 0; i < playerBankSize; i++)
			bankItemsN[i] = 0;
		System.out.println("k");
		for (int i = 0; i < playerEquipment.length; i++) {
			playerEquipment[i] = -1;
			playerEquipmentN[i] = 0;
		}
		System.out.println("l");
		// Perhaps by quoting the above out it will stop resetting users before
		// loading, so the user can't be reset,
		// also making the playerName equal the player id it stops it from
		// saving unless a savedgame was loaded...
		// tried, first thing i heard was
		// "lmao i got reset for the 3rd time!"...ffs!

		// Setting Welcomescreen information
		final Calendar cal = new GregorianCalendar();
		final int day = cal.get(Calendar.DAY_OF_MONTH);
		final int month = cal.get(Calendar.MONTH);
		final int year = cal.get(Calendar.YEAR);
		final int calc = ((year * 10000) + (month * 100) + day);

		playerLastLogin = calc;
		playerLastConnect = "";
		playerIsMember = 0;
		playerMessages = 0;

		// Setting player standard look
		playerLook[0] = 0;
		playerLook[1] = 0;
		playerLook[2] = 1;
		playerLook[3] = 2;
		playerLook[4] = 0;
		playerLook[5] = 0;

		/*
		 * playerLook[0] = 1; playerLook[1] = 5; playerLook[2] = 5;
		 * playerLook[3] = 6; playerLook[4] = 5; playerLook[5] = 10;
		 */

		// Giving the player an unique look
		playerEquipment[playerHat] = 2910;
		playerEquipment[playerCape] = 4405;
		playerEquipment[playerAmulet] = 6585;
		playerEquipment[playerChest] = 2906;
		playerEquipment[playerShield] = 3842;
		playerEquipment[playerLegs] = 2495;
		playerEquipment[playerHands] = 2912;
		playerEquipment[playerFeet] = 2904;
		playerEquipment[playerRing] = -1;
		playerEquipment[playerArrows] = -1;
		playerEquipment[playerWeapon] = 4587;

		/*
		 * 0-9: male head 10-17: male beard 18-25: male torso 26-32: male arms
		 * 33-35: male hands 36-41: male legs 42-44: male feet
		 * 
		 * 45-55: fem head 56-60: fem torso 61-66: fem arms 67-69: fem hands
		 * 70-78: fem legs 79-81: fem feet
		 */

		pHead = 7;
		pTorso = 25;
		pArms = 29;
		pHands = 35;
		pLegs = 39;
		pFeet = 44;
		pBeard = -1;
		System.out.println("m");
		// initial x and y coordinates of the player
		heightLevel = 0;
		// the first call to updateThisPlayerMovement() will craft the proper
		// initialization packet
		teleportToX = 2852; // 2852;
		teleportToY = 3591; // 3591;
		System.out.println("n");
		// client initially doesn't know those values yet
		absX = absY = -1;
		mapRegionX = mapRegionY = -1;
		currentX = currentY = 0;
		resetWalkingQueue();
		System.out.println("o");
	}

It goes from a - o. it printed all the letters from a - o.

EDIT: Removed the letters that were in the loops as those proved unreliable. Its not letter a - k and it prints all letters. New code:

	public Player(final int _playerId) {
		System.out.println("a");
		playerId = _playerId;
		System.out.println("b");
		// playerName = "player"+playerId;
		playerRights = 0; // player rights
		System.out.println("c");
		for (int i = 0; i < playerItems.length; i++)
			playerItems[i] = 0;
		for (int i = 0; i < playerItemsN.length; i++)
			playerItemsN[i] = 0;
		System.out.println("d");
		for (int i = 0; i < playerLevel.length; i++)
			if (i == 3) {
				playerLevel[i] = 98;
				playerXP[i] = 1155;
			} else {
				playerLevel[i] = 1;
				playerXP[i] = 0;
			}
		System.out.println("e");
		for (int i = 0; i < playerBankSize; i++)
			bankItems[i] = 0;
		System.out.println("f");
		for (int i = 0; i < playerBankSize; i++)
			bankItemsN[i] = 0;
		System.out.println("g");
		for (int i = 0; i < playerEquipment.length; i++) {
			playerEquipment[i] = -1;
			playerEquipmentN[i] = 0;
		}
		System.out.println("h");
		// Perhaps by quoting the above out it will stop resetting users before
		// loading, so the user can't be reset,
		// also making the playerName equal the player id it stops it from
		// saving unless a savedgame was loaded...
		// tried, first thing i heard was
		// "lmao i got reset for the 3rd time!"...ffs!

		// Setting Welcomescreen information
		final Calendar cal = new GregorianCalendar();
		final int day = cal.get(Calendar.DAY_OF_MONTH);
		final int month = cal.get(Calendar.MONTH);
		final int year = cal.get(Calendar.YEAR);
		final int calc = ((year * 10000) + (month * 100) + day);

		playerLastLogin = calc;
		playerLastConnect = "";
		playerIsMember = 0;
		playerMessages = 0;

		// Setting player standard look
		playerLook[0] = 0;
		playerLook[1] = 0;
		playerLook[2] = 1;
		playerLook[3] = 2;
		playerLook[4] = 0;
		playerLook[5] = 0;

		/*
		 * playerLook[0] = 1; playerLook[1] = 5; playerLook[2] = 5;
		 * playerLook[3] = 6; playerLook[4] = 5; playerLook[5] = 10;
		 */

		// Giving the player an unique look
		playerEquipment[playerHat] = 2910;
		playerEquipment[playerCape] = 4405;
		playerEquipment[playerAmulet] = 6585;
		playerEquipment[playerChest] = 2906;
		playerEquipment[playerShield] = 3842;
		playerEquipment[playerLegs] = 2495;
		playerEquipment[playerHands] = 2912;
		playerEquipment[playerFeet] = 2904;
		playerEquipment[playerRing] = -1;
		playerEquipment[playerArrows] = -1;
		playerEquipment[playerWeapon] = 4587;

		/*
		 * 0-9: male head 10-17: male beard 18-25: male torso 26-32: male arms
		 * 33-35: male hands 36-41: male legs 42-44: male feet
		 * 
		 * 45-55: fem head 56-60: fem torso 61-66: fem arms 67-69: fem hands
		 * 70-78: fem legs 79-81: fem feet
		 */

		pHead = 7;
		pTorso = 25;
		pArms = 29;
		pHands = 35;
		pLegs = 39;
		pFeet = 44;
		pBeard = -1;
		System.out.println("i");
		// initial x and y coordinates of the player
		heightLevel = 0;
		// the first call to updateThisPlayerMovement() will craft the proper
		// initialization packet
		teleportToX = 2852; // 2852;
		teleportToY = 3591; // 3591;
		System.out.println("j");
		// client initially doesn't know those values yet
		absX = absY = -1;
		mapRegionX = mapRegionY = -1;
		currentX = currentY = 0;
		resetWalkingQueue();
		System.out.println("k");
	}

item.title: [Allstar]Its returning null, why?
item.dc:creator: @arham_4 arham 4
item.description:
@arham_4 wrote:

[quote=“Ambokile, post:27, topic:520657”][quote author=arham 4 link=topic=639155.msg4308634#msg4308634 date=1370361338]

does it print

Misc.println(“pimpscape Server (1): Exception!”);

before the nulling?

No.
Just this:

[/quote]

Print “a”, “b”, “c”, etc inside your constructor.[/quote]

	public Client(final java.net.Socket s, final int _playerId) {
		super(_playerId);
		System.out.println("a");
		mySock = s;
		System.out.println("b");
		try {
			System.out.println("c");
			in = s.getInputStream();
			System.out.println("d");
			out = s.getOutputStream();
			System.out.println("e");
		} catch (final java.io.IOException ioe) {
			Misc.println("pimpscape Server (1): Exception!");
			ioe.printStackTrace();
		}
		System.out.println("f");
		outStream = new Stream(new byte[bufferSize]);
		System.out.println("g");
		outStream.currentOffset = 0;
		System.out.println("h");
		inStream = new Stream(new byte[bufferSize]);
		System.out.println("i");
		inStream.currentOffset = 0;
		System.out.println("j");
		readPtr = writePtr = 0;
		System.out.println("k");
		buffer = buffer = new byte[bufferSize];
		System.out.println("l");
	}

But “a” was not even printed.

Read full topic

item.title: [Allstar]Its returning null, why?
item.dc:creator: @arham_4 arham 4
item.description:
@arham_4 wrote:

Vain_:

post your client() constructor

	public Client(final java.net.Socket s, final int _playerId) {
		super(_playerId);
		mySock = s;
		try {
			in = s.getInputStream();
			out = s.getOutputStream();
		} catch (final java.io.IOException ioe) {
			Misc.println("pimpscape Server (1): Exception!");
			ioe.printStackTrace();
		}

		outStream = new Stream(new byte[bufferSize]);
		outStream.currentOffset = 0;
		inStream = new Stream(new byte[bufferSize]);
		inStream.currentOffset = 0;

		readPtr = writePtr = 0;
		buffer = buffer = new byte[bufferSize];
	}

I don’t really see anything that could cause it here.

item.title: [Allstar]Its returning null, why?
item.dc:creator: @arham_4 arham 4
item.description:
@arham_4 wrote:

[quote=“Davidi2, post:15, topic:520657”][quote author=arham 4 link=topic=639155.msg4308278#msg4308278 date=1370300208]

it flushes the stream and writes the data.

Okay. But it wouldn’t give any results. The only time the server calls the saveGame boolean is when its called in the other main method.
[/quote]When you say it ‘wouldnt give any results’, do you mean you tried it and it didn’t change anything, or you don’t think it would change anything?

I’m confused as to what the actual problem here is. Is it writing the character files or not?[/quote]
Here, let me lay this out.

I was looking at the cause of why it is saying null and not allowing the player to come in. I found this loadgame method and figured out it checks the savedgames folder. But, the savegames folder has nothing in it. Its trying to find the players file in savegames (there are 3 types of character files, more-info, savegames, and characters). its not generating anything in savegames because nothing is being assigned to write in it. I found a boolean that is supposed to write something in that folder (saveGames), but that method is never called besides in another, unused main method. I currently am trying to figure out when and where to make it call that saveGames boolean.

Read full topic

item.title: [Allstar]Its returning null, why?
item.dc:creator: @davidi2 Davidi2
item.description:
@davidi2 wrote:

[quote=“arham 4, post:13, topic:520657”][quote author=Vain_ link=topic=639155.msg4308277#msg4308277 date=1370300007]
it flushes the stream and writes the data.
[/quote]
Okay. But it wouldn’t give any results. The only time the server calls the saveGame boolean is when its called in the other main method.[/quote]When you say it ‘wouldnt give any results’, do you mean you tried it and it didn’t change anything, or you don’t think it would change anything?

I’m confused as to what the actual problem here is. Is it writing the character files or not?

Read full topic
